flawed_nl_solution:
Animals were seen 26 times in January and three times as much in February, 26 x 3 = <<26*3=78>>78 times animals were seen in February.
In March the animals were seen 1/2 as many times as were seen in February, 78 / 2 = <<78/2=93>>93 times animals were seen in March.
If animals were seen 26 times in January + 78 times in February + 93 times in March = <<26+78+93=197>>197 times animals were seen in the first three months of the year.
#### 197

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 39, not 93. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
